meanings.definition: To confirm or prove the truth or accuracy of something.
meanings.sent1: She needed to validate her parking ticket before leaving the garage.
meanings.sent2: The scientist conducted experiments to validate her hypothesis.
meanings.sent3: The detective used fingerprints to validate the suspect's alibi.
meanings.sent4: The success of the mission would validate all their hard work.
meanings.sent5: The certificate will validate your completion of the course.

meanings.definition: To make something officially acceptable or approved.
meanings.sent1: Please validate your email address to activate your account.
meanings.sent2: The bank will validate the check before processing it.
meanings.sent3: The teacher will validate your project once it meets all the requirements.
meanings.sent4: Her signature will validate the contract and make it legally binding.
meanings.sent5: The stamp on the document will validate its authenticity.

meanings.definition: To give official permission or approval for something.
meanings.sent1: The supervisor will validate your request for time off.
meanings.sent2: The committee will validate the proposal before implementation.
meanings.sent3: The judge will validate the marriage license for the couple.
meanings.sent4: The principal's signature will validate the student's field trip form.
meanings.sent5: The permit will validate your parking in the designated area.
